concept.title: POLYGON Command
concept.shortdesc: Creates a closed polyline in the shape of a polygon.

conbody.p: Create a closed polyline in the shape of an equal-sided polygon. Options allow you to specify the center, number of sides, edge length and angle, and the distance from the center to the vertex or midpoint of an edge.

section.title: Methods to begin a polygon
section.p: There is one method to begin creating a polygon:

dlentry.dd: Begin creating a polygon by specifying the number of sides between 3 and 1024 then:
Specify the center point of the polygon.
Specify the location of the midpoint of a polygon line segment. The location of the midpoint defines the size and angle of the polygon.

section.title: Additional options within the POLYGON command
section.p: After you begin creating a polygon, the following options may be available.

dlentry.dd: Specify the width of the polygon line segments. All segments have the same width.
Create multiple polygons with the same size and orientation when using the Set center of polygon option. Continue placing polygons until you press Enter to end the command.
Specify the endpoints of one edge of the polygon to define its size and angle.
Specify the location of a vertex of the polygon. The location of the vertex defines the size and angle of the polygon.
